alert.note: Alert for Coeur d'Alene Area (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 29 at 10:14PM MST until December 01 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 10 inches. * WHERE...Spokane Valley, Hayden, Post Falls, Cheney, Davenport, Fairfield, Airway Heights, Rockford, Coeur d`Alene, Downtown Spokane, and Worley. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to 10 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Motorists should be prepared for winter driving conditions Wednesday especially during the morning hours. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow with this storm will occur on Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Persons should delay all travel if possible. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution and be prepared for sudden changes in visibility. Leave plenty of room between you and the motorist ahead of you, and allow extra time to reach your destination. Avoid sudden braking or acceleration, and be especially cautious on hills or when making turns. Make sure your car is winterized and in good working order.
